country_overview.content: Grenada, known as the 'Spice Isle' for its production of nutmeg and other spices, is famous for its beautiful beaches, waterfalls, and vibrant culture. Popular attractions include Grand Anse Beach and the historic Fort George. Most visitors can enter Grenada without a visa for short stays. For longer stays or specific purposes, a visa may be necessary.

tourist_visa.title: Tourist Visa
tourist_visa.description: The Tourist Visa allows visitors to stay in Grenada for up to 90 days for tourism purposes. It is usually not required for short visits from many countries.

student_visa.title: Student Visa
student_visa.description: The Student Visa is for individuals accepted into a Grenadian educational institution. It allows for full-time study and is valid for the duration of the course plus possible extensions.

work_visa.title: Work Visa
work_visa.description: The Work Visa is for foreign nationals seeking employment in Grenada. It is generally valid for up to 2 years and is linked to a specific employer.

tourist_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must show proof of tourism intent, a valid passport, sufficient funds, and intent to return to their home country. An interview may be required.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
additional_documents: Letter of invitation from a friend or family member (if applicable)
Proof of employment or studies in the home country

student_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must have been accepted into a Grenadian educational institution and prove financial capacity to support themselves during their studies.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Letter of acceptance from a Grenadian educational institution

work_visa.eligibility_criteria: Applicants must have a job offer from a Grenadian employer and meet the required qualifications. The work visa application requires approval from Grenadian authorities.
mandatory_documents: Valid passport with at least six months of validity
Job offer letter or employment contract
Proof of relevant qualifications and experience
additional_documents: Proof of any previous visits to Grenada

step_1.title: Determine Visa Type
step_1.description: Identify the appropriate visa type based on your purpose of visit to Grenada. Ensure you meet the eligibility requirements for the selected visa category.

step_2.title: Check Eligibility
step_2.description: Review the specific eligibility requirements for the visa type you are applying for, including health and character requirements.

step_3.title: Gather Required Documents
step_3.description: Collect all necessary documents including the visa application form, passport, photographs, and supporting documents relevant to your visa type.

step_4.title: Complete the Application Form
step_4.description: Fill out the visa application form accurately. Applications can be submitted online or through Grenadian embassies and consulates.

step_5.title: Submit the Application
step_5.description: Submit your completed application form along with the required documents. Ensure that all documents are provided as per the requirements for your visa type.

step_6.title: Wait for Processing
step_6.description: Processing times for Grenadian visas vary based on the type of visa and individual circumstances. Check current processing times with the Grenadian consulate or embassy.

step_7.title: Receive the Visa
step_7.description: Once your visa is approved, you will be notified. Ensure that all details on the visa are correct before traveling.

visa_fees.content: Visa fees for Grenadian visas vary depending on the type of visa and duration of stay. Fees are payable at the time of application and are non-refundable.

processing_time.content: Processing times for Grenadian visas vary. Tourist visas are typically processed within a few weeks, while student and work visas may take longer. Check current processing times with the Grenadian consulate or embassy.

visa_validity.content: The validity of Grenadian visas depends on the type of visa issued. Tourist visas are generally valid for up to 90 days, while work and student visas may be valid for the duration of employment or study plus a possible extension.

entry_requirements.content: Upon arrival in Grenada, travelers must present their valid visa (if required), passport, and may be required to provide additional documentation such as proof of accommodation and sufficient funds.

faq_1.question: Can I extend my visa while in Grenada?
faq_1.answer: Visa extensions may be possible depending on the type of visa. You should contact Grenadian immigration authorities for detailed information on the extension process.

faq_2.question: Is a visa required before arrival in Grenada?
faq_2.answer: For most nationalities, a visa is not required for short visits. However, check with the nearest Grenadian embassy or consulate to confirm visa requirements based on your nationality.

faq_3.question: Can I work in Grenada on a Tourist Visa?
faq_3.answer: No, working on a Tourist Visa is not allowed. If you wish to work in Grenada, you must apply for a Work Visa.
